Galesburg VA in 1948 had UI extension courses for soliders. Soldiers in using wheelchairs wanted to continue their studies at Univeristy of Illinois. Initially rejected for admission to Illinois based solely on their disability and their perceived inability to be able to live independently on campus. Soldiers lobbied the state government and university administration to be admitted. Had the highest grade point average of all the houses on campus during their first year on campus. After 6 years the "Rehab" program offically changed from experimental (e.g. unfundex) to become an offical part (funded) program of the University of Illinois. Disabilities Services Program First post-secondary institution to provide support services to enable students with disabilities to attend, led by Tim Nugent. Transportation Services First post-secondary institution to provide a scheduled accessible bus routes. Competitive Sports: Wheelchair Basketball Organized the first organized national wheelchair sporting competitions. Competitive Sports: Early Racing Wheelchair Early sporting events used modified hospital wheelchairs that were not designed for self-propulsion. Competitive Sports: Modern Racing Chairs DRES coaches and racers help design and test modern wheelchairs for racing, using titaniuum and composit materials. If current students and alumi would have been a country at the last winter paraolympics in Russia, they would have had the 6th higheest metal total of any country. In the Rio paraolympic games Illini wemone swept the gold, sliver and bronze in two events. Architectural Standards: Temporary Ramp Portable ramps were used in the early days to provide wheelchair access to buildings. Architectural Standards: Permanent Ramp As the program grew more permanent ramps were constructed with the slopes and widths determined by research at Illinois. Architectural Standards: No Ramp New construction on campus does not include steps, gentile loping sidewalks provide accessible routes into buildings. Beckwith Program: Student Access First program to offer residential housing for students who need personal attendant services. Beckwith Program at Nugent Hall: Student Inclusion Nugent Hall integrates Beckwith Program in to the campus residential dorms with 22 full accessible rooms with overhead lifts and accessible bathrooms. Each new dorm floor has an accessible room to allow for full inclusion of students with disabilities in dorm life.
